questions.question: Your limit on playing video games is up.  What do you do?

choices.answer: Complain to your mom
Tease your sister
Get mad and throw the game
Pull out a toy you haven't played with in awhile

questions.question: Your mom is having a bad day.  She is grumpy and you feel sad. What can you do?

choices.answer: Hug her and tell her you love her
Tell her she's being mean
Play your drum set really loud.
Fight with your brother

questions.question: You don't like the activity your teacher has planned for indoor recess. What can you do?

choices.answer: Complain to the teacher
Pout and act like a two year old
Fold your arms and don't cooperate
Be a good sport and try the activity.

questions.question: Your brother insists on pouring the milk, then spills it everywhere! What can you do?

choices.answer: Say "I told you so!"
Tell him "it's okay. I'll help you clean it."
Yell at him.
Slide in the milk and make a bigger mess.

questions.question: Your friend is having a bad day. He refuses to listen to the teacher.  What can you do to help?

choices.answer: Make funny faces at your friend.
Throw paper at your friend.
Yell at your friend to shape up.
Smile at your friend, and quietly tell him to pay attention.

questions.question: Your friend comes over to play. but you can't agree on a game.  What can you do?

choices.answer: Tell your friend it's your house, so you get to decide.
Open the door and tell your friend to go home.
Offer to take turns and both of you get your way.
Tell him it's your way or the highway!

questions.question: Your brother is playing with your favorite toy.  What can you do?

choices.answer: Grab it from him.
Get your brother's favorite toy, and play with it.
Let him play with it, but tell him to ask permission.
Tattle to your mom

questions.question: Your dad asks you to turn off the tv and help with the dishes.  What will you do?

choices.answer: Act like you didn't hear him.
Break a few dishes on purpose.
Do the dishes like you are told.
Do the dishes but don't clean them well.

questions.question: You got a gift from your friend that you already had.  What do you say?

choices.answer: I don't like this gift!
Thank you for the nice gift!
I already have one of these!
This gift is silly!

questions.question: Your brother won't stop bothering you, even though you asked him to leave you alone. What now?

choices.answer: Yell at him!
Leave the room and slam the door.
Tackle your brother!
Take a deep breath and ask him to play a game.

questions.question: Your new classmate is standing alone at recess?  What can you do?

choices.answer: Ask him to play with you and your friends.
Ignore him!
Run away from him.
Play something they don't like to play.

questions.question: Your friends are spraying water in the bathroom.  What can you do?

choices.answer: Spray water on them!
Tattle to the teacher!
Ask your friends to please stop!
Yell at them - tell them they're going to be in big trouble.

questions.question: You see an elderly lady who dropped her groceries.  What can you do?

choices.answer: Nothing
Help her pick everything up.
Step on her bananas
Pick up her apples and try to juggle.

questions.question: You have a substitute who is having trouble figuring out how to work the computer. What next?

choices.answer: Tell the sub the class can just go to recess.
Help the sub and tell her what the teacher usually does.
Start laughing with your friends.
Have another snack!

questions.question: Your friend is struggling with a math problem?  What can you do to help?

choices.answer: Tell him the answer!
Let him copy from your paper!
Show him the steps to work the problem.
Tell him to figure it out!

questions.question: A friend in your class never gets picked for "Heads up 7-Up!" How can you help?

choices.answer: Ignore him or her
Tell your friends not to pick them.
You make sure you pick someone who never gets picked!
Tell them not to play.
